page.title: 15Ancient Uyeasound.
page.content: Some tourists come to Uyeasound to see the ancient remains which illustrate our early history. Cairns are Stone-Age burial chambers.They are found nowhere else in Britain except Shetland.One can be found on Gallow Hill and another at the Loch of Snabrough. Brochs date from over a thousand years ago.They were built as defences and the one to be found on north side of the Loch of Snabrough overlooks Bluemull Sound which is a known Viking routeway. At Belmont on the approach to Gallow Hill is the site of a Norse Farmstead,probably built about 800 A.D.This shows that the Vikings settled in Unst and did not only use it as a stopping-off point on their way to the Western Isles and Ireland.
